result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J Bultman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
With Huber.  Sentence credit of 65 days was granted.
10/12/16 CORRECTED TO HUBER.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Balance Inquiry
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC

Defendant Jason J Bultman in court with Attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Benedict makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

 COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

120 DAYS HUBER   (CREDIT - 65 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant Jason J Bultman in court, in custody, with attorney Anna Kees, for attorney Samuel W. Benedict.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kees presents statements to the court.  State presemts statements to the court.  Court will quash the warrant.  Bail remains as fixed.  Court will order that Mr. Bultman be released and appear for his next court date on 8/16/16 at 2:00 pm.
